attributes.action: Cap all fuel prices below 1.50 a litre.
attributes.additional_details: We ask that the Government and parliament to put a cap that stop all fuel prices exceeding a £1.50 per litre to allow people continue working and providing public services until the pay rate matches the inflation rate across the UK.
attributes.background: Stop fuel surcharges across the UK to allow people to be able to continue getting to work and provide services. Until the pay rate increases to match inflation rates.

rejection.details:
The Government is not directly responsible for the price of fuel, but we have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

Hold an inquiry into fuel prices and introduce increased regulation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603624

We have also published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

Stop charging VAT on fuel duty: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599411
